content.description: Start on two crimps with your foot around the arete on a good ledge. Reach up high and to the right and grab a crimpy gaston, get your foot up on the starting hold, and stand up high to a sloper dish. From here, find a way to get to the sloping lip without having your feet slip.
content.location: It is on the slab face with your back towards the ocean.

content.description: Start on a good jug shelf at about chest height, get a good foot in a hueco-like feature, and either dyno/deadpoint straight up to a jug or use the arete to the right.
content.location: This is the back side of the boulder to the right of Death By Mac N Cheese.

content.description: Start on two crimps at slightly lower than chest height, get some good feet, and move your right hand to a crimp up and right. Then go left to a sidepull, hike your feet up to the starting crimp rail, and make a dynamic move to a jug up and in between the two holds you're holding onto. A lower start is possible - adding one hard move off the ground into the starting crimp rail.
content.location: It is on the right side of the boulder face next to Fat Man On Campus.

content.description: Start on the left side of the boulder, reach up above your head, and grab a sloper with your left hand and a slopey edge right next to it for your right hand that you can almost crimp on. Pull on, and campus to the long jug shelf above that. A low start is possible that would add probably three moves but would be hard.
content.location: It is on the left side of the boulder with the stairs at your back, the sloper arete.

content.description: This is the low start to Loaded Diaper. Look down and left of the starting holds, and you'll see a sidepull rail. Use this and some okay feet to pull up, latch one of the stand start starting holds, and take it to the top.
content.location: It is the low start to Loaded Diaper.

content.description: Start on the side of the boulder away from the stairs you walked down, with your back to the larger boulder. Find two good edges just to the right of the slab on the right-leaning arete. Find a smear for a foot, make a big move out to your right, almost a full iron cross, to a sloping 3/4 pad edge, get a left heel up on the starting hold, and lock off to the jug shelf just over the arete on the slab. Make use of a really cool, two finger, pocket intermediate before the jug shelf if need be. This may be the best established line on the boulder.
content.protection: It sometimes has a rocky landing, so use a pad or two.
content.location: This is on the smaller boulder on the shore down the Great Rock Bight trail just before the larger boulder.

content.description: Brown Pearl is a fun, couple of move, right-to-left traverse into Mother of Pearl.Start on two blocky crimps at chest-height on the corner arete to the right of Mother of Pearl. Get your foot on a small protrusion straight down and/or out left and low on the low hueco. Pull left around the corner, fall into a pinch between the starting holds with your right hand, then move to juggy ledge, and top out as for Mother of Pearl.
content.location: Start on the corner to the right of Mother of Pearl.

content.description:
This is an open project. It is the low start to Fat Man On Campus.

 Start with your left hand on a decent sidepull and your right hand on the obvious jug but sloping edge near the middle of the face. Use some body tension, the sloping left arete, and an intermediate sloping crimp to somehow get to the start holds of Fat Man On Campus.
content.location: It is the low start to Fat Man on Campus.

content.description: The smaller of the two boulders on the shore line that is usually not flooded with water with a couple fun lines on it
